acceptOwnership().details: The new owner accepts the ownership transfer.

createOrder(bytes32,address,uint256,stri.details: See {createOrder - IPaymentProcessor} create an order referencing a merchantId (merchant must be registered)

returns.createdAt: The timestamp when order was created

getPlatformWallet().details: Returns the address of the platform wallet that receives fees

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

pendingOwner().details: Returns the address of the pending owner.

refundOrder(bytes32).details: Merchant refunds net amount, platform refunds fee Can be called by owner(platform) or merchant

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

params.enabled: Whether emergency withdrawal should be enabled

transferOwnership(address).details: Starts the ownership transfer of the contract to a new account. Replaces the pending transfer if there is one. Can only be called by the current owner. Setting `newOwner` to the zero address is allowed; this can be used to cancel an initiated ownership transfer.

updateMerchantRegistry(address).details: Emitted when the merchant registry is updated

params.newRegistry: The address of the new deployed contract

cancelOrder(bytes32).notice: Cancel an order that was CREATED [no funds moved] Only payer can cancel

emergencyWithdraw(address,address,uint25.notice: Emergency withdrawal function for contract funds

getContractTokenBalance(address).notice: Returns the ERC20 token balance held by this contract (pending settlements / escrow)

getMerchantTokenBalance(address,address).notice: Returns the ERC20 token balance of a merchant wallet (for dashboard display)

getOrder(bytes32).notice: update merchantRegistry address - if you upgrade registry

getOrderRemainingTime(bytes32).notice: Get remaining time before order expires

getPlatformTokenBalance(address).notice: Returns the ERC20 token balance of the platform wallet (total value held by platform wallet)

isOrderExpired(bytes32).notice: Check if an order has expired

payOrder(bytes32).notice: Pay an order: payer must have approved this contract Payer pays (must have approved)

refundOrder(bytes32).notice: Refund an order back to payer

settleOrder(bytes32).notice: Settle and order : transfer funds to merchant minus fee Can be called by merchant or platform to support automated flows

@dev Pause the contract
@dev Unpase the contract
